title: Usage: background refresh on app launch
description:
Goal
- Preload usage data when the app launches and keep it refreshed in the background.

Acceptance
- On app launch: triggers an immediate usage refresh (Current + saved profiles).
- While app is running: refreshes every 10 minutes automatically, even if the Usage screen is not open.
- Manual Refresh button still works.

Notes
- Implement as an idempotent start method on the shared UsageDashboardViewModel and start it from AppDelegate.
acceptance_criteria: - Verified by code + builds: xcodebuild Debug (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release succeed.
close_reason: Evidence: xcodebuild Debug OK (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release OK; script tests OK: UsageModelsTests, AccountStoreTests, CredentialExporterTests, UsageFetcherTests, ProfileSwitcherTests. Background refresh now starts on app launch (AppDelegate) and refreshes every 10 minutes via shared UsageDashboardViewModel, even when Usage screen isn't open.

title: State change: phase → review

Set phase to review

Reason: Verified: xcodebuild Debug build OK (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release build OK; script tests OK (UsageModels/AccountStore/CredentialExporter/UsageFetcher/ProfileSwitcher). Started shared UsageDashboardViewModel background refresh from AppDelegate on app launch; auto refresh continues every 10 minutes regardless of UI visibility.
close_reason: Event recorded

title: Usage: reset countdown notifications + live timer
description: Add reset-time alerting: when 5h reset has <=1h remaining, show live countdown and pop the Island every 10m with account + remaining time. When 7d reset has <=6h remaining, pop the Island every 1h; when <=1h, every 10m; when <=10m, keep Island open and show live 10-minute countdown list (include all overlapping accounts).
acceptance_criteria:
- 5h: <=1h remaining shows live countdown (updates every second) and Island pops every 10m showing account + remaining
- 7d: <=6h remaining triggers hourly Island pops; <=1h triggers every 10m; <=10m keeps Island open with live countdown
- If multiple accounts overlap, Island shows list of all with remaining reset times
- No focus stealing; should not interrupt user typing
- App builds (Debug/Release) + make up installs
close_reason: Evidence: xcodebuild Debug build OK (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release build OK (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO). Script tests OK: UsageModelsTests, AccountStoreTests, CredentialExporterTests, ProfileSwitcherTests, UsageFetcherTests. make up succeeded (Release build, installed to /Applications/Claude Island.app, app quit+relaunch). Added Usage reset alerting: 5h <=1h shows live countdown (m/s) + Island pops every 10m; 7d <=6h pops hourly, <=1h every 10m, <=10m keeps Island open with live countdown list (shows all overlapping accounts).

title: Usage: Auto refresh every 10 minutes
description:
Goal
- Keep Refresh button, but auto-refresh usage data: initial full refresh after view loads, then full refresh every 10 minutes.
- Always render something immediately (do not clear existing snapshots while refreshing).

Acceptance
- Usage screen triggers a full refresh on appear (Current + all saved profiles).
- Refresh runs automatically every 10 minutes (skips if a refresh is already running).
- Manual Refresh button still works.
- Builds succeed (Debug CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO + Release).
close_reason: Auto refresh every 10 min + initial full refresh on appear (Current + all profiles); manual Refresh kept; skips if already refreshing. xcodebuild Debug(CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO)+Release succeeded; 2 files changed (+43/-6).

title: State change: phase → review
description:

Reason: Auto-refresh: initial full refresh + 10-minute timer; manual Refresh button kept; refresh skips if already running. Verified xcodebuild Debug(CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release build.
close_reason: State-change event recorded; no further action.

title: Usage UI: provider icons (Claude/Codex/Gemini) with equal sizing
description:
Goal
- Replace provider name text (Claude/Codex/Gemini) with the provided icons.
- Icons must render at the same size everywhere they appear in Usage UI.

Acceptance
- Usage dashboard provider headers show icon instead of provider name text
- Reset alerts list rows show icon instead of provider name text
- Icons are bundled in the app (no dependency on repo-local paths)
- Build + make up succeed

Assets
- claude.svg
- codex.svg
- gemini.png
close_reason: Usage UI now uses provider icons (claude.svg/codex.svg/gemini.png) instead of provider name text, with a fixed 14pt frame so all providers render the same size. Assets are bundled in the app (Xcode fileSystemSynchronizedGroup for assets/ + Bundle URL loading). Verified: xcodebuild Release + Debug succeeded; make up succeeded (Release build + install to /Applications + relaunch).

title: UI: Token refresh countdown bar + ignore .claude logs
description:
Goal
- Show remaining time until auth token refresh/expiry as a small bar in each provider card.
- Ignore local Claude/Codex chat logs directories in git.

Acceptance
- Each provider card shows an extra row like: tok [bar] <time remaining>.
- Uses credential expiry when available (Codex JWT exp/iat; Gemini expiry_date/expiresAt; Claude oauth expires fields if present).
- .gitignore ignores `.claude/raw_logs/` and `.claude/chat_logs/`.
- Builds succeed (Debug CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO + Release).
close_reason: Token refresh countdown bar (tok) added to each provider card; .gitignore ignores .claude/raw_logs + .claude/chat_logs; xcodebuild Debug (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release succeeded; 4 files changed (+297/-14).

close_reason: State-change event recorded; no further action.

title: Usage tabs: hide Current when it matches a saved profile; mark matching profile as LIVE
description:
Goal
- If Current credentials are identical to a saved profile, don't show the redundant Current tab.
- Instead, show the matching profile tab with a LIVE marker.
- If Current later diverges from all saved profiles, Current should reappear (LIVE).

Acceptance
- Tabs:
  - Always show Dashboard (ALL)
  - Show Current (LIVE) only when it does NOT match any saved profile
  - If it matches Profile X, hide Current and show Profile X with LIVE marker
- Selection stability:
  - If user is on Current and it becomes hidden, automatically switch to the matching LIVE profile tab
  - If selected profile disappears, fall back to Dashboard
- Matching should be robust (use the same credential hash/account-id logic as ProfileSwitcher)

Notes
- Keep all UI strings in English
- No text wrapping/regressions
close_reason: Tabs now hide redundant Current when it matches a saved profile and mark the matching profile as LIVE; matching uses the same credential hash/account-id logic as ProfileSwitcher; selection auto-moves to the live tab when live target changes. Verified: xcodebuild Release build succeeded; make up succeeded (Release build + install + relaunch).

title: State change: phase → review
description:
Set phase to review

Reason: Hide redundant Current tab when it matches a saved profile; show matching profile as LIVE; robust matching via credential hash/account-id; verified xcodebuild Release build + make up.
close_reason: State-change event recorded; no further action.

title: Usage dashboard: prettier compact cards + Gemini 24h window
description:
## Problem
The Usage/Profiles cards were readable but cramped; reset times wrapped. Gemini window is effectively 24h (not 5h).

## Expected
- Gemini shows 24h window label
- Usage window rows stay single-line (no wrapping)
- Bars look like a compact segmented meter (similar to [||||||-----])
close_reason: Gemini now displays 24h window; usage rows stay single-line; segmented bars match compact [|||||-----] look; duration formatting improved. Verified xcodebuild Debug (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release builds succeeded.

title: UI: Improve usage bars + English text
description:
Goal
- Improve Usage dashboard readability based on external review.

Work
- Remove the confusing token refresh row ("tok").
- For Claude/Codex 5h + 7d rows: show dual progress bars (usage remaining + time-to-reset).
- Show tier as a colored badge in the provider header (not a separate row).
- Convert all UI strings on Usage screen + menu to English.

Notes
- Usage bar color: green → red (based on remaining).
- Reset timer bar color: cool tone (blue).
- Tier badge colors: Claude Pro=white, Max5=orange, Max20=red; Codex Plus=white, Pro=red.
acceptance_criteria:
- No "tok" label/row in UI.
- Claude/Codex rows show 2 bars: usage + time-to-reset; both have numeric labels below.
- Tier badge colors match spec.
- All visible strings are English.
- xcodebuild Debug (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release build succeed.

UI updated: removed "tok" row; Claude/Codex 5h/7d show dual bars (usage + reset timer in blue) with numeric labels; tier badges use spec colors; all visible menu/usage strings are English.

Implemented dual bars (usage remaining + reset timer) and tier badges; removed "tok" row; converted menu + usage strings to English.

title: Usage dashboard: show Current snapshot when no profiles
description:
## Problem
Profiles/Usage screen shows 'No profiles yet' even when Claude/Codex/Gemini logins exist on this machine. This is confusing; users expect at least a 'current credentials' snapshot without needing to press Save Profile first.

## Repro
1. Ensure local CLI logins exist (Claude/Codex/Gemini).
2. Open app → Usage/Profiles.
3. Observe empty state: 'No profiles yet'.

## Expected
Show a 'Current (unsaved)' row (or similar) using current machine credentials, and allow Refresh to fetch usage, even if no saved profiles exist.

## Notes
Docker-based usage scripts can't access macOS Keychain; we need to export creds into a temp HOME for the container run.
close_reason: Fix: Usage/Profiles shows a 'Current (unsaved)' row and fetches usage from live CLI creds (exported to temp HOME for docker). Verified: xcodebuild Debug build (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) succeeded; xcodebuild Release build (codesigned) succeeded.

description:
Set phase to review

Reason: Show Current (unsaved) usage row using live CLI creds exported into temp HOME for docker usage script; xcodebuild Debug+Release build succeeded.
close_reason: Event recorded

title: Usage: dashboard grid for all accounts
description:
Goal
- On the Usage screen, make the default view a grid dashboard that shows usage for every saved account (not one profile at a time).

Behavior
- Group by provider and render in this order: Claude, then Codex, then Gemini.
- Grid layout example (3 columns):
  - If Claude 4, Codex 2, Gemini 2:
    Claude1 Claude2 Claude3
    Claude4 Codex1  Codex2
    Gemini1 Gemini2

Acceptance
- Usage screen default shows the full dashboard grid for all accounts.
- Uses existing usage fetching/caching; refresh button + auto refresh should refresh all tiles.
- Builds succeed (Debug CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO + Release).
close_reason: Evidence: xcodebuild Debug OK (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release OK; script tests OK: UsageModelsTests, AccountStoreTests, CredentialExporterTests, UsageFetcherTests, ProfileSwitcherTests. Usage screen default now shows a Dashboard grid of all saved accounts, rendered in provider order (Claude, Codex, Gemini) in a 3-column layout.

Acceptance

- Do not show a previous email for a different account (key by account-id).
- Works for Current + saved profiles + Dashboard tiles.
- Build + make up succeed.
close_reason: On refresh errors/provider ERR, Usage UI now keeps showing the last known account email (and Claude tier) for the same account-id by remembering identities and backfilling missing fields. Profiles list shows multiple profile cards stacked. Even with compact cards, it eats vertical space and feels cramped.

Show a tabbed selector (Current + saved profiles) and display only one profile's usage card at a time to reclaim space.

title: Usage dashboard: show account email + remaining quota + time windows
description:
## Problem
Current Usage/Profiles UI shows only compact '5h/7d' numbers (e.g. 1/2) and does not surface which account is logged in. Users want to see:
- account identifier (email)
- remaining quota (or used+remaining)
- time window (5h / 7d) and time until reset

## Expected
For each service (Claude/Codex/Gemini), show email (best-effort) and detailed usage lines per window (5h, 7d): percent + reset time remaining, with a simple bar indicator.
close_reason: Implemented detailed Usage/Profiles cards: show account email (Claude via /api/oauth/profile; Codex/Gemini via JWT email claim), remaining % + reset countdown per window (5h/7d). Verified xcodebuild Debug (CODE_SIGNING_ALLOWED=NO) + Release builds succeeded.
